combat_description.name: The merfolk warrior presented here had the following ability scores before racial adjustments
combat_description.desc: Str 13, Dex 11, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 9, Cha 8.

name: Mimic
description: A mimic can have almost any dimensions, but usually is not more than 10 feet long. A typical mimic has a volume of 150 cubic feet (5 feet by 5 feet by 6 feet) and weighs about 4,500 pounds.
Mimics speak Common.

combat_description.desc: A mimic often surprises an unsuspecting adventurer, lashing out with a heavy pseudopod. The creature does not necessarily fight to the death if it can succeed in extorting treasure or food from a party.

combat_description.name: Adhesive (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A mimic exudes a thick slime that acts as a powerful adhesive, holding fast any creatures or items that touch it. An adhesive-covered mimic automatically grapples any creature it hits with its slam attack. Opponents so grappled cannot get free while the mimic is alive without removing the adhesive first.
A weapon that strikes an adhesive-coated mimic is stuck fast unless the wielder succeeds on a DC 16 Reflex save. A successful DC 16 Strength check is needed to pry it off.
Strong alcohol dissolves the adhesive, but the mimic still can grapple normally. A mimic can dissolve its adhesive at will, and the substance breaks down 5 rounds after the creature dies.

combat_description.name: Crush (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A mimic deals 1d8+4 points of damage with a successful grapple check.

combat_description.name: Mimic Shape (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A mimic can assume the general shape of any object that fills roughly 150 cubic feet (5 feet by 5 feet by 6 feet), such as a massive chest, a stout bed, or a wide door frame. The creature cannot substantially alter its size, though. A mimic’s body is hard and has a rough texture, no matter what appearance it might present. Anyone who examines the mimic can detect the ruse with a successful Spot check opposed by the mimic’s Disguise check. Of course, by this time it is generally far too late.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A mimic has a +8 racial bonus on Disguise checks.

name: Minotaur
description: A minotaur stands more than 7 feet tall and weighs about 700 pounds.
Minotaurs speak Giant.

combat_description.desc: Minotaurs prefer melee combat, where their great strength serves them well.

combat_description.name: Powerful Charge (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A minotaur typically begins a battle by charging at an opponent, lowering its head to bring its mighty horns into play. In addition to the normal benefits and hazards of a charge, this allows the beast to make a single gore attack with a +9 attack bonus that deals 4d6+6 points of damage.

combat_description.name: Natural Cunning (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Although minotaurs are not especially intelligent, they possess innate cunning and logical ability. This gives them immunity to maze spells, prevents them from ever becoming lost, and enables them to track enemies. Further, they are never caught flat-footed.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Minotaurs have a +4 racial bonus on Search, Spot, and Listen checks.

name: Mohrg

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Slam +12 melee (1d6+7) or tongue +12 melee touch (paralysis)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Slam +12 melee (1d6+7) and tongue +12 melee touch (paralysis)

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Improved grab, paralyzing touch, create spawn

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Lightning Reflexes, Mobility

special_attacks: Improved grab, paralyzing touch, create spawn
organization: Solitary, gang (2–4), or mob (2–4 plus 5–10 zombies)
description: Mohrgs are the animated corpses of mass murderers or similar villains who died without atoning for their crimes.
Most mohrgs are 5 to 6 feet tall and weigh about 120 pounds.

combat_description.desc: Like zombies, mohrgs attack by slamming enemies with their fists. They often catch opponents flat-footed, for they move much faster than zombies.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a mohrg must hit a creature of its size or smaller with its slam attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity.

combat_description.name: Paralyzing Touch (Su)
combat_description.desc: A mohrg lashes out with its tongue in combat. An opponent the tongue touches must succeed on a DC 17 Fortitude save or become paralyzed for 1d4 minutes. The save DC is Charisma-based.

combat_description.name: Create Spawn (Su)
combat_description.desc: Creatures killed by a mohrg rise after 1d4 days as zombies under the morhg’s control. They do not possess any of the abilities they had in life.

name: Mummy
organization: Solitary, warden squad (2–4), or guardian detail (6–10)
description: Mummies are preserved corpses animated through the auspices of dark desert gods best forgotten.
Most mummies are 5 to 6 feet tall and weigh about 120 pounds.
Mummies can speak Common, but seldom bother to do so.

combat_description.name: Despair (Su)
combat_description.desc: At the mere sight of a mummy, the viewer must succeed on a DC 16 Will save or be paralyzed with fear for 1d4 rounds. Whether or not the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by the same mummy’s despair ability for 24 hours. The save DC is Charisma-based.

combat_description.name: Mummy Rot (Su)
combat_description.desc: Supernatural disease - slam, Fortitude DC 16, incubation period 1 minute; damage 1d6 Con and 1d6 Cha. The save DC is Charisma-based.
Unlike normal diseases, mummy rot continues until the victim reaches Constitution 0 (and dies) or is cured as described below.

Mummy rot is a powerful curse, not a natural disease. A character attempting to cast any conjuration (healing) spell on a creature afflicted with mummy rot must succeed on a DC 20 caster level check, or the spell has no effect on the afflicted character.

To eliminate mummy rot, the curse must first be broken with break enchantment or remove curse (requiring a DC 20 caster level check for either spell), after which a caster level check is no longer necessary to cast healing spells on the victim, and the mummy rot can be magically cured as any normal disease.
An afflicted creature who dies of mummy rot shrivels away into sand and dust that blow away into nothing at the first wind.

name: Dark Naga

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Sting +7 melee (2d4+2 plus poison) and bite +2 melee (1d4+1)

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Darkvision 60 ft., detect thoughts, guarded thoughts

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness, Combat Casting, Dodge, Eschew Materials (B), Lightning Reflexes

description: Dark nagas speak Common and Infernal.

combat_description.desc: Dark nagas prefer to fight from an elevated position where they get a good view of the battlefield while also staying out of reach.

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury, Fortitude DC 16 or lapse into a nightmare-haunted sleep for 2d4 minutes. The save DC is Constitution-based.

spells.Spells: : Dark nagas cast spells as 7th-level sorcerers.

name: Guardian Naga

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Bite +12 melee (2d6+7 plus poison) or spit +9 ranged touch (poison)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Bite +12 melee (2d6+7 plus poison) or spit +9 ranged touch (poison)

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness, Combat Casting, Dodge, Eschew Materials (B), Lightning Reflexes

description: Guardian nagas speak Celestial and Common.

combat_description.desc: Guardian nagas usually warn off intruders before attacking. If the warning is ignored, they may begin a spell assault or spit poison.

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury or contact, Fortitude DC 19, initial and secondary damage 1d10 Con. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Spit (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A guardian naga can spit its venom up to 30 feet as a standard action. This is a ranged touch attack with no range increment. Opponents hit by this attack must make successful saves (see above) to avoid the effect.

spells.Spells: : Guardian nagas cast spells as 9th-level  sorcerers, and can also cast spells from the  cleric list and from the  Good and  Law domains. The cleric spells and domain spells are considered arcane spells for a guardian naga, meaning that the creature does not need a divine focus to cast them.

name: Spirit Naga

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Ability Focus, Alertness, Combat Casting, Eschew Materials (B), Lightning Reflexes

description: Spirit nagas speak Abyssal and Common.

combat_description.desc: Spirit nagas meet foes boldly so as to use their gaze attacks to best effect. They quickly slither forward to bite foes that avert their eyes.

combat_description.name: Charming Gaze (Su)
combat_description.desc: As charm person, 30 feet, Will DC 19 negates. The save DC is Charisma-based.

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury, Fortitude DC 18, initial and secondary damage 1d8 Con. The save DC is Constitution-based.

spells.Spells: : Spirit nagas cast spells as 7th-level  sorcerers, and can also cast spells from the  cleric spell list and from the  Chaos and  Evil domains as arcane spells. The cleric spells and domain spells are considered arcane spells for a spirit naga, meaning that the creature does not need a divine focus to cast them.

name: Water Naga

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness, Combat Casting, Eschew Materials (B), Lightning Reflexes

description: Water nagas speak Aquan and Common.

combat_description.desc: Water nagas prefer to stay mostly concealed in a body of water while they launch a spell attack.

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury, Fortitude DC 17, initial and secondary damage 1d8 Con. The save DC is Constitution-based.

spells.Spells: : Water nagas cast spells as 7th-level sorcerers but never use fire spells.

name: Night Hag
damage_immunities: fire, cold, charm, sleep, and fear
organization: Solitary, mounted (1, on nightmare), or covey (3, on nightmares)
description: A night hag is about the same height and weight as a female human.
Night hags speak Abyssal, Celestial, Common, and Infernal.

combat_description.desc: Night hags attack good creatures on sight if the odds of success seem favorable.
These creatures rip through armor and flesh with their deadly teeth. They love to use sleep and then strangle those who are overcome by it.

A night hag’s natural weapons, as well as any weapons it wields, are treated as evil-aligned for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. Its natural weapons are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

combat_description.name: Change Shape (Su)
combat_description.desc: A night hag can assume the form of any Small or Medium humanoid.

combat_description.name: Disease (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Demon fever - bite, Fortitude DC 18, incubation period 1 day, damage 1d6 Con. Each day after the first, on a failed save, an afflicted creature must immediately succeed on another DC 18 Fortitude save or take 1 point of Constitution drain. The save DC is Constitution based.

combat_description.name: Dream Haunting (Su)
combat_description.desc: Night hags can visit the dreams of chaotic or evil individuals by using a special periapt known as a heartstone to become ethereal, then hovering over the creature. Once a hag invades someone’s dreams, it rides on the victim’s back until dawn. The sleeper suffers from tormenting dreams and takes 1 point of Constitution drain upon awakening. Only another ethereal being can stop these nocturnal intrusions, by confronting and defeating the night hag.

spells.Caster Level: Caster level 8th. . The save DCs are Charisma-based.

spells.At will: [[3.5 Spell List#Detect Chaos|Detect Chaos]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Detect Evil|Detect Evil]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Detect Good|Detect Good]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Detect Law|Detect Law]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Detect Magic|Detect Magic]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Magic Missile|Magic Missile]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Ray Of Enfeeblement|Ray Of Enfeeblement]] (DC 12), [[3.5 Spell List#Sleep|Sleep]] (DC 12);

spells.Other: A night hag can use etherealness at will (caster level 16th) so long as it possesses its heartstone (see below)

name: Nightmare

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: 2 hooves +9 melee (1d8+4 plus 1d4 fire) and bite +4 melee (1d8+2)

description: A nightmare is about the size of a light war horse.

combat_description.desc: A nightmare can fight while carrying a rider, but the rider cannot also fight unless he or she succeeds on a Ride check.
A nightmare’s natural weapons, as well as any weapons it wields, are treated as evil-aligned for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

combat_description.name: Flaming Hooves (Su)
combat_description.desc: A blow from a nightmare’s hooves sets combustible materials alight.

combat_description.name: Smoke (Su)
combat_description.desc: During the excitement of battle, a nightmare snorts and neighs with rage. This snorting fills a 15-foot cone with a hot, sulfurous smoke that chokes and blinds opponents. Anyone in the cone must succeed on a DC 16 Fortitude save or take a –2 penalty on all attack and damage rolls until 1d6 minutes after leaving the cone. The cone lasts 1 round, and the nightmare uses it once as a free action during its turn each round. The save DC is Constitution-based.

Because of the smoke it gives off, a nightmare has concealment against creatures 5 feet away and total concealment against creatures 10 feet or farther away. The smoke does not obscure the nightmare’s vision at all.

combat_description.name: Astral Projection and Etherealness (Su)
combat_description.desc: These abilities function just like the spells of the same names (caster level 20th); a nightmare can use either at will.

combat_description.name: Carrying Capacity
combat_description.desc: A light load for a nightmare is up to 300 pounds; a medium load, 301–600 pounds; and a heavy load, 601–900 pounds.

name: Nightcrawler

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Bite +29 melee (4d6+21/19–20) and sting +24 melee (2d8+11/19–20 plus poison)

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Desecrating aura, energy drain, spell-like abilities, poison, summon undead, swallow whole

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: , darkvision 60 ft., telepathy 100 ft, tremorsense 60 ft., undead traits

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Blind-Fight, Combat Casting, Great Fortitude, Improved Critical, Improved Critical, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Power Attack, Quicken Spell-Like Ability

special_attacks: Desecrating aura, energy drain, spell-like abilities, poison, summon undead, swallow whole
description: A nightcrawler is a massive behemoth similar to a purple worm, though utterly black in color.
A nightcrawler measures about 7 feet in diameter and is 100 feet long from its toothy maw to the tip of its stinging tail. It weighs about 55,000 pounds.

combat_description.desc: A nightcrawler attacks by burrowing through the ground and emerging to strike.
A nightcrawler’s natural weapons are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

combat_description.name: Energy Drain (Su)
combat_description.desc: Living creatures inside a nightcrawler’s gizzard gain one negative level each round. The DC is 26 for the Fortitude save to remove a negative level. The save DC is Charisma-based. For each such negative level bestowed, the nightcrawler gains 5 temporary hit points.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a nightcrawler must hit with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can try to swallow the opponent in the following round.

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury, Fortitude DC 22, initial and secondary damage 2d6 Str. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Summon Undead (Su)
combat_description.desc: A nightcrawler can summon undead creatures once per night

combat_description.name: Swallow Whole (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A nightcrawler can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of Huge or smaller size by making a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d8+12 points of bludgeoning damage plus 12 points of acid damage per round from the nightcrawler’s gizzard and is subject to the creature’s energy drain. A swallowed creature can cut its way out by using a light slashing or piercing weapon to deal 35 points of damage to the gizzard (AC 21). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out.
A nightcrawler’s interior can hold 2 Huge, 8 Large, 32 Medium, 128 Small, 512 Tiny or smaller opponents.

spells.Caster Level: Caster level 25th. The save DCs are Charisma-based.

name: Nightwalker

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Crush item, desecrating aura, evil gaze, spell-like abilities, summon undead

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: , darkvision 60 ft., telepathy 100 ft., undead traits

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Cleave, Combat Expertise, Combat Reflexes, Great Fortitude, Improved Disarm, Improved Initiative, Power Attack, Quicken Spell-Like Ability

special_attacks: Crush item, desecrating aura, evil gaze, spell-like abilities, summon undead
description: Nightwalkers are human-shaped horrors that haunt the darkness.
A nightwalker is about 20 feet tall and weighs about 12,000 pounds.

combat_description.desc: Nightwalkers lurk in dark areas where they can almost always surprise the unwary.
A nightwalker’s natural weapons are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

combat_description.name: Crush Item (Su)
combat_description.desc: A nightwalker can destroy any weapon or item of Large size or smaller (even magic ones, but not artifacts) by picking it up and crushing it between its hands. The nightwalker must make a successful disarm attempt to grab an item held by an opponent. The item is entitled to a DC 34 Fortitude save to resist destruction. The save DC is Strength-based.

combat_description.name: Evil Gaze (Su)
combat_description.desc: Fear, 30 feet. A creature that meets the nightwalker’s gaze must succeed on a DC 24 Will save or be paralyzed with fear for 1d8 rounds. Whether or not the save is successful, that creature cannot be affected again by the same nightshade’s gaze for 24 hours. This is a mind-affecting fear effect. The save DC is Charisma-based.

combat_description.name: Summon Undead (Su)
combat_description.desc: A nightwalker can summon undead creatures once per night

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: *When hiding in a dark area, a nightwalker gains a +8 racial bonus on Hide checks.

spells.Caster Level: Caster level 21st. The save DCs are Charisma-based.

spells.At will: [[3.5 Spell List#Contagion|Contagion]] (DC 18), [[3.5 Spell List#Deeper Darkness|Deeper Darkness]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Detect Magic|Detect Magic]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Dispel Magic, Greater|Dispel Magic, Greater]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Haste|Haste]] , [[3.5 Spell List#See Invisibility|See Invisibility]] , [[3.5 Spell List#And Unholy Blight|And Unholy Blight]] (DC 18);

name: Nightwing

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Desecrating aura, magic drain, spell-like abilities, summon undead

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: , darkvision 60 ft., telepathy 100 ft., undead traits

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Flyby Attack, Great Fortitude, Improved Critical, Improved Initiative

special_attacks: Desecrating aura, magic drain, spell-like abilities, summon undead
description: Nightwings are batlike flyers that hunt on the wing.
A nightwing has a wingspan of about 40 feet and weighs about 4,000 pounds.

combat_description.desc: Nightwings prowl the night sky and dive onto their victims. They are all but invisible, detectable only because of the stars they obscure in their passing.
A nightwing’s natural weapons are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

combat_description.name: Magic Drain (Su)
combat_description.desc: A nightwing can weaken magic armor, weapons, and shields by making a successful touch attack. The targeted item must succeed on a DC 22 Fortitude save or lose 1 point of its enhancement bonus. The save DC is Charisma-based. An item that loses its entire enhancement bonus becomes merely a masterwork item and loses any special abilities (such as flaming) as well. Casting dispel evil upon the item reverses the effect of the magic drain, provided this occurs within a number of days after the attack equal to the caster’s level and the caster succeeds on a DC 29 caster level check.

spells.Caster Level: Caster level 17th. The save DCs are Charisma-based.

name: 4th-level Barbarian Ogre
speed: 40 ft. in hide armor (8 squares); base speed 50 ft.
ac: 19 (-1 size, +5 natural, +4 +1 hide armor, ring of protection +1)

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, trap sense +1, uncanny dodge

organization: Solitary, pair, gang (1 plus 1-3 ogres), or band (1 plus 4-7 ogres)
treasure: Standard (including +1 hide armor, +1 greatclub, and ring of protection +1)

combat_description.desc: Ogres favor overwhelming odds, sneak attacks, and ambushes over a fair fight. They are intelligent enough to fire ranged weapons first to soften up their foes before closing, but ogre gangs and bands fight as unorganized individuals.

Ogres favor overwhelming odds, sneak attacks, and ambushes over a fair fight. They are intelligent enough to fire ranged weapons first to soften up their foes before closing, but ogre gangs and bands fight as unorganized individuals.
Marginally more intelligent than his brutish fellows, an ogre barbarian is slightly more likely to enter a fair fight, but in general prefers the brutish tactics common to all its kind.

combat_description.name: Rage (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Twice per day, an ogre barbarian can enter a state of fierce rage that last for 9 rounds. The following changes are in effect as long as he rages

combat_description.name: Trap Sense (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An ogre barbarian has a +1 bonus on Reflex saves made to avoid traps. He also has a +1 bonus to his AC against attacks by traps.

combat_description.name: Uncanny Dodge (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An ogre barbarian retains his Dex bonus to AC regardless of being caught flat-footed or attacked by an invisible opponent. His Dex bonus to AC is +0, but this means that he is not subject to a rogue's sneak attack in these circumstances.

name: Ogre
speed: 30 ft. in hide armor (6 squares); base speed 40 ft.

combat_description.desc: Ogres favor overwhelming odds, sneak attacks, and ambushes over a fair fight. They are intelligent enough to fire ranged weapons first to soften up their foes before closing, but ogre gangs and bands fight as unorganized individuals.

Ogres favor overwhelming odds, sneak attacks, and ambushes over a fair fight. They are intelligent enough to fire ranged weapons first to soften up their foes before closing, but ogre gangs and bands fight as unorganized individuals.
Marginally more intelligent than his brutish fellows, an ogre barbarian is slightly more likely to enter a fair fight, but in general prefers the brutish tactics common to all its kind.

combat_description.name: Rage (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Twice per day, an ogre barbarian can enter a state of fierce rage that last for 9 rounds. The following changes are in effect as long as he rages

combat_description.name: Trap Sense (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An ogre barbarian has a +1 bonus on Reflex saves made to avoid traps. He also has a +1 bonus to his AC against attacks by traps.

combat_description.name: Uncanny Dodge (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An ogre barbarian retains his Dex bonus to AC regardless of being caught flat-footed or attacked by an invisible opponent. His Dex bonus to AC is +0, but this means that he is not subject to a rogue's sneak attack in these circumstances.

name: Ogre Mage
organization: Solitary, pair, or troupe (1–2 plus 2–4 ogres)
description: The ogre mage is a more intelligent and dangerous variety of its mundane cousin.

An ogre mage stands about 10 feet tall and weighs up to 700 pounds. Its skin varies in color from light green to light blue, and its hair is black or very dark brown. Ogre mages favor loose, comfortable clothing and lightweight armor.
Ogre mages speak Giant and Common.

combat_description.desc: Ogre mages rely on their spell-like abilities, resorting to physical combat only when necessary. When faced with obviously superior forces, they prefer to retreat using gaseous form rather than fight a losing battle.

combat_description.name: Change Shape (Su)
combat_description.desc: An ogre mage can assume the form of any Small, Medium, or Large humanoid or giant.

combat_description.name: Flight (Su)
combat_description.desc: An ogre mage can cease or resume flight as a free action. While using gaseous form it can fly at its normal speed and has perfect maneuverability.

combat_description.name: Regeneration (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Fire and acid deal normal damage to an ogre mage.

An ogre mage that loses a limb or body part can reattach it by holding the severed member to the stump. Reattachment takes 1 minute. If the head or some other vital organ is severed, it must be reattached within 10 minutes or the creature dies. An ogre mage cannot regrow lost body parts.

spells.Caster Level: Caster level 9th. The save DCs are Charisma-based.

spells.1/day: [[3.5 Spell List#Charm Person|Charm Person]] (DC 14), [[3.5 Spell List#Cone Of Cold|Cone Of Cold]] (DC 18), [[3.5 Spell List#Gaseous Form|Gaseous Form]] , [[3.5 Spell List#Sleep|Sleep]] (DC 14);

name: Black Pudding

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Acid, constrict 2d6+4 plus 2d6 acid, improved grab

special_attacks: Acid, constrict 2d6+4 plus 2d6 acid, improved grab
description: The typical black pudding measures 15 feet across and 2 feet thick. It weighs about 18,000 pounds.

combat_description.desc: A black pudding attacks by grabbing and squeezing their prey.

combat_description.name: Acid (Ex)
combat_description.desc: The creature secretes a digestive acid that dissolves organic material and metal quickly, but does not affect stone. Any melee hit or constrict attack deals acid damage, and the opponent's armor and clothing dissolve and become useless immediately unless they succeed on DC 21 Reflex saves. A metal or wooden weapon that strikes a black pudding also dissolves immediately unless it succeeds on a DC 21 Reflex save. The save DCs are Constitution-based.
The pudding's acidic touch deals 21 points of damage per round to wooden or metal objects, but the ooze must remain in contact with the object for 1 full round to deal this damage.

combat_description.name: Constrict (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A black pudding deals automatic slam and acid damage with a successful grapple check. The opponent's clothing and armor take a -4 penalty on Reflex saves against the acid.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a black pudding must hit with its slam attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.

combat_description.name: Split (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Slashing and piercing weapons deal no damage to a black pudding. Instead the creature splits into two identical puddings, each with half of the original's current hit points (round down). A pudding with 10 hit points or less cannot be further split and dies if reduced to 0 hit points.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A black pudding has a +8 racial bonus on Climb checks and can always choose to take 10 on a Climb check, even if rushed or threatened.

name: Gelatinous Cube
treasure: 1/10th coins, 50% goods (no nonmetal or nonstone), 50% items (no nonmetal or nonstone)
description: The nearly transparent gelatinous cube travels slowly along dungeon corridors and cave floors, absorbing carrion, creatures, and trash. Inorganic material remains trapped and visible inside the cube's body.
A typical gelatinous cube is 15 feet on a side and weighs about 50,000 pounds, though much larger specimens are not unknown.

combat_description.desc: A gelatinous cube attacks by slamming its body into its prey. It is capable of lashing out with a pseudopod, but usually engulfs foes.

combat_description.name: Acid (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A gelatinous cube's acid does not harm metal or stone.

combat_description.name: Engulf (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Although it moves slowly, a gelatinous cube can simply mow down Large or smaller creatures as a standard action. It cannot make a slam attack during a round in which it engulfs. The gelatinous cube merely has to move over the opponents, affecting as many as it can cover. Opponents can make opportunity attacks against the cube, but if they do so they are not entitled to a saving throw. Those who do not attempt attacks of opportunity must succeed on a DC 13 Reflex save or be engulfed; on a success, they are pushed back or aside (opponent's choice) as the cube moves forward. Engulfed creatures are subject to the cube's paralysis and acid, and are considered to be grappled and trapped within its body. The save DC is Strength-based and includes a +1 racial bonus.

combat_description.name: Paralysis (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A gelatinous cube secretes an anesthetizing slime. A target hit by a cube's melee or engulf attack must succeed on a DC 20 Fortitude save or be paralyzed for 3d6 rounds. The cube can automatically engulf a paralyzed opponent. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Transparent (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Gelatinous cubes are hard to see, even under ideal conditions, and it takes a DC 15 Spot check to notice one. Creatures who fail to notice a cube and walk into it are automatically engulfed.

name: Gray Ooze

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Acid, constrict 1d6+1 plus 1d6 acid, improved grab

special_attacks: Acid, constrict 1d6+1 plus 1d6 acid, improved grab
description: A gray ooze can grow to a diameter of up to 10 feet and a thickness of about 6 inches. A typical specimen weighs about 700 pounds.

combat_description.desc: A gray ooze strikes like a snake, slamming opponents with its body.

combat_description.name: Acid (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A gray ooze secretes a digestive acid that quickly dissolves organic material and metal, but not stone. Any melee hit or constrict attack deals acid damage. Armor or clothing dissolves and becomes useless immediately unless it succeeds on a DC 16 Reflex save. A metal or wooden weapon that strikes a gray ooze also dissolves immediately unless it succeeds on a DC 16 Reflex save. The save DCs are Constitution-based.
The ooze's acidic touch deals 16 points of damage per round to wooden or metal objects, but the ooze must remain in contact with the object for 1 full round to deal this damage.

combat_description.name: Constrict (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A gray ooze deals automatic slam and acid damage with a successful grapple check. The opponent's clothing and armor take a -4 penalty on Reflex saves against the acid.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a gray ooze must hit with its slam attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.

combat_description.name: Transparent (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A gray ooze is hard to identify, even under ideal conditions, and it takes a DC 15 Spot check to notice one. Creatures who fail to notice a gray ooze and walk into it are automatically hit with a melee attack for slam and acid damage.

name: Ochre Jelly

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Acid, constrict 2d4+3 plus 1d4 acid, improved grab

special_attacks: Acid, constrict 2d4+3 plus 1d4 acid, improved grab
description: An ochre jelly can grow to a diameter of about 15 feet and a thickness of about 6 inches, but can compress its body to fit into cracks as small as 1 inch wide. A typical specimen weighs about 5,600 pounds.

combat_description.desc: An ochre jelly attempts to envelop and squeeze its prey.

combat_description.name: Acid (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An ochre jelly secretes a digestive acid that dissolves only flesh. Any melee hit or constrict attack deals acid damage.

combat_description.name: Constrict (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An ochre jelly deals automatic slam and acid damage with a successful grapple check.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, an ochre jelly must hit with its slam attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.

combat_description.name: Split (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Slashing and piercing weapons and electricity attacks deal no damage to an ochre jelly. Instead the creature splits into two identical jellies, each with half of the original's current hit points (round down). A jelly with 10 hit points or less cannot be further split and dies if reduced to 0 it points.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: An ochre jelly has a +8 racial bonus on Climb checks and can always choose to take 10 on a Climb check, even if rushed or threatened.

name: Otyugh
description: A typical otyugh has a body 8 feet in diameter and weighs about 500 pounds.
Otyughs speak Common.

combat_description.desc: An otyugh attacks living creatures if it feels threatened or if it is hungry; otherwise it is content to remain hidden. Otyughs slash and squeeze opponents with their tentacles, which they also use to drag prey into their mouths.

combat_description.name: Constrict (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An otyugh deals automatic tentacle damage with a successful grapple check.

combat_description.name: Disease (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Filth fever - bite, Fortitude DC 14, incubation period 1d3 days; damage 1d3 Dex and 1d3 Con. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, an otyugh must hit with a tentacle attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: *An otyugh has a +8 racial bonus on Hide checks when in its lair, due to its natural coloration.

name: Giant Owl
description: Giant owls are nocturnal birds of prey, feared for their ability to hunt and attack in near silence. They are intelligent, and though naturally suspicious, sometimes associate with good creatures. A typical giant owl stands about 9 feet tall, has a wingspan of up to 20 feet, and resembles its smaller cousins in nearly every way except size.
Giant owls speak Common and Sylvan.

combat_description.desc: A giant owl attacks by gliding silently just a few feet above its prey and plunging to strike when directly overhead.

combat_description.name: Superior Low-Light Vision (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A giant owl can see five times as far as a human can in dim light.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Giant owls have a +8 racial bonus on Listen checks and a +4 racial bonus on Spot checks.
*When in flight, giant owls gain a +8 bonus on Move Silently checks.

name: Owlbear
description: An owlbear’s coat ranges in color from brown-black to yellowish brown; its beak is a dull ivory color. A full-grown male can stand as tall as 8 feet and weigh up to 1,500 pounds. Adventurers who have survived encounters with the creature often speak of the bestial madness they glimpsed in its red-rimmed eyes.

combat_description.desc: Owlbears attack prey - any creature bigger than a mouse - on sight, always fighting to the death. They slash with claws and beak, trying to grab their prey and rip it apart.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, an owlbear must hit with a claw attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity.

name: Pegasus

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Darkvision 60 ft., low-light vision, scent, spell-like abilities

description: The pegasus is a magnificent winged horse that sometimes serves the cause of good. Though highly prized as aerial steeds, pegasi are wild and shy creatures not easily tamed.
A typical pegasus stands 6 feet high at the shoulder, weighs 1,500 pounds, and has a wingspan of 20 feet.
Pegasi cannot speak, but they understand Common.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Pegasi have a +4 racial bonus on Listen and Spot checks.

spells.Caster Level: Caster level 5th.

spells.At will: [[3.5 Spell List#Detect Good And Detect Evil Within A 60|Detect Good And Detect Evil Within A 60]] ;.foot radius

name: Phantom Fungus

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Low-light vision, plant traits, greater invisibility

description: This creature looks like a brown and greenish-brown mass with a cluster of nodules atop the main mass, though it is visible only when dead. A cluster of nodules atop the main mass serve as sensory organs. The creature feeds and attacks with a gaping maw lined with rows of teeth. Four stumpy legs support the creature and allow it to move about.
This ambulatory fungus is naturally invisible, making it a feared predator among subterranean inhabitants.

combat_description.desc: A phantom fungus usually roams quietly, hunting for prey. It attacks lone individuals almost anywhere, but when tackling groups it prefers an open space where it has a better chance .

combat_description.name: Greater Invisibility (Su)
combat_description.desc: This ability is constant, allowing a phantom fungus to remain invisible even when attacking. It works like greater invisibility (caster level 12th) and lasts as long as the phantom fungus is alive. This ability is not subject to the invisibility purge spell. A phantom fungus becomes visible 1 minute after it is killed.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A phantom fungus has a +5 racial bonus on Move Silently checks.

name: Phase Spider
description: Special Qualitiy: Darkvision 60 ft., ethereal jaunt, low-light vision
Phase spiders are aggressive predators that can move quickly from the Ethereal Plane to attack opponents on the Material Plane.
A typical phase spider’s body is 8 feet long. It weighs about 700 pounds.
Phase spiders cannot speak.

combat_description.desc: Phase spiders dwell and hunt on the Material Plane. Once a spider locates prey, however, it shifts to the Ethereal Plane to attack, attempting to catch its victim flat-footed. The spider shifts in, bites its victim, and retreats quickly back to the Ethereal Plane.

combat_description.name: Ethereal Jaunt (Su)
combat_description.desc: A phase spider can shift from the Ethereal Plane to the Material Plane as a free action, and shift back again as a move action (or during a move action). The ability is otherwise identical with ethereal jaunt (caster level 15th).

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury, Fortitude DC 17, initial and secondary damage 1d8 Con. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A phase spider has a +8 racial bonus on Climb checks and can always choose to take 10 on a Climb check, even if rushed or threatened.

name: Phasm

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Alternate form, amorphous, resilient, scent, telepathy 100 ft., tremorsense 60 ft.

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness, Blind-Fight, Combat Reflexes, Dodge, Improved Initiative, Mobility

description: A phasm is an amorphous creature that can assume the guise of almost any other creature or object. A phasm in its natural form is about 5 feet in diameter and 2 feet high at the center. Swirls of color indicate sensory organs. In this form, a phasm slithers about like an ooze and can attack with a pseudopod. It weighs about 400 pounds.
Phasms can speak Common but prefer telepathic communication.

combat_description.desc: When faced with potential danger, a phasm is equally likely to retreat, parley, or attack, as its fancy strikes.
If pursued or harassed, a phasm transforms into the most fearsome creature it knows and attacks. When seriously hurt, it changes to some fast or agile form and tries to escape.

combat_description.name: Amorphous (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A phasm in its natural form has immunity to poison, sleep, paralysis, polymorph, and stunning effects. It is not subject to critical hits and, having no clear front or back, cannot be flanked.

combat_description.name: Resilient (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A phasm has a +4 racial bonus on Fortitude and Reflex saves (included in the statistics block).

combat_description.name: Alternate Form (Su)
combat_description.desc: A phasm can assume any form of Large size or smaller as a standard action. This ability functions as a polymorph spell cast on itself (caster level 15th), except that the phasm does not regain hit points for changing form. A phasm can remain in its alternate form until it chooses to assume a new one or return to its natural form.

combat_description.name: Tremorsense (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A phasm can automatically sense the location of anything within 60 feet that is in contact with the ground, so long as it is touching the ground itself.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: *When using shapechange, a phasm gains a +10 circumstance bonus on Disguise checks.

name: Aasimar
speed: 20 ft. in scale mail (4 squares); base speed 30 ft.

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Longsword +2 melee (1d8+1/19–20) or light crossbow +1 ranged (1d8/19–20)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Longsword +2 melee (1d8+1/19–20) or light crossbow +1 ranged (1d8/19–20)

description: Aasimars are usually tall, good-looking, and generally pleasant. Some have a minor physical trait suggesting their heritage, such as silver hair, golden eyes, or an unnaturally intense stare.

Most aasimars are decidedly good-aligned. They fight against evil causes and attempt to sway others to do the right thing. Occasionally they take on the vengeful, judgmental aspect of their celestial ancestor, but this is rare.

combat_description.desc: Aasimars usually like a fair, straightforward contest. Against a particularly evil foe, however, they fight with utter conviction and to the death.

combat_description.name: Daylight (Sp)
combat_description.desc: An aasimar can use daylight once per day as a 1st-level caster or a caster of his class levels, whichever is higher.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: An aasimar has a +2 racial bonus on Spot and Listen checks.

combat_description.name: The aasimar warrior presented here had the following ability scores before racial adjustments
combat_description.desc: Str 13, Dex 11, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 9, Cha 8.

name: Tiefling

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Rapier +3 melee (1d6+1/18–20) or light crossbow +2 ranged (1d8/19–20)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Rapier +3 melee (1d6+1/18–20) or light crossbow +2 ranged (1d8/19–20)

description: Many tieflings are indistinguishable from humans. Others have small horns, pointed teeth, red eyes, a whiff of brimstone about them, or even cloven feet. No two tieflings are the same.

combat_description.desc: Tieflings are sneaky, subtle, and generally conniving. They prefer to strike from ambush and usually avoid a fair fight if they can.

combat_description.name: Darkness (Sp)
combat_description.desc: A tiefling can use darkness once per day (caster level equal to class levels).

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A tiefling has a +2 racial bonus on Bluff and Hide checks.

combat_description.name: The tiefling warrior presented here had the following ability scores before racial adjustments
combat_description.desc: Str 13, Dex 11, Con 12, Int 10, Wis 9, Cha 8.

name: Pseudodragon

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Sting +4 melee (1d3–2 plus poison) and bite –1 melee (1)

damage_immunities: sleep and paralysisBlindsense 60 ft., darkvision 60 ft.
description: A pseudodragon has a body about 1 foot long, with a 2-foot tail. It weights about 7 pounds.
A pseudodragon can communicate telepathically and can also vocalize animal noises.

combat_description.desc: A pseudodragon can deliver a vicious bite, but its principal weapon is its sting-equipped tail.

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury, Fortitude DC 14, initial damage sleep for 1 minute, secondary damage sleep for 1d3 hours. The save DC is Constitution-based and includes a +2 racial bonus.

combat_description.name: Blindsense (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A pseudodragon can locate creatures within 60 feet by nonvisual means (mostly hearing and scent, but also by noticing vibration and other environmental clues). Opponents the pseudodragon can’t actually see still have total concealment against the pseudodragon.

combat_description.name: Telepathy (Su)
combat_description.desc: Pseudodragons can communicate telepathically with creatures that speak Common or Sylvan, provided they are within 60 feet.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Pseudodragons have a chameleonlike ability that grants them a +4 racial bonus on Hide checks. *In forests or overgrown areas, this bonus improves to +8.

name: Purple Worm
speed: 20 ft. (4 squares), burrow 20 ft., swim 10 ft.

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Bite +25 melee (2d8+12) and sting +20 melee (2d6+6 plus poison)

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Awesome Blow, Cleave, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack, Weapon Focus, Weapon Focus

treasure: No coins, 50% goods (stone only), no items
description: The body of a mature purple worm is 5 feet in diameter and 80 feet long, weighing about 40,000 pounds. The creature has a poisonous stinger in its tail.

combat_description.desc: In battle, a purple worm forms into a coil 20 feet in diameter, biting and stinging anything within reach.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a purple worm must hit with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can attempt to swallow the foe the following round.

combat_description.name: Poison (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Injury, Fortitude DC 25, initial damage 1d6 Str, secondary damage 2d6 Str. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Swallow Whole (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A purple worm can try to swallow a grabbed opponent of a smaller size than itself by making a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d8+12 points of crushing damage plus 8 points of acid damage per round from the worm’s gizzard. A swallowed creature can cut its way out by using a light slashing or piercing weapon to deal 25 points of damage to the gizzard (AC 17). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out. A Gargantuan worm’s interior can hold 2 Large, 8 Medium, 32 Small, 128 Tiny, or 512 Diminutive or smaller opponents.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A purple worm has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

name: Rakshasa
treasure: Standard coins; double goods; standard items
description: A closer look at a rakshasa reveals that the palms of its hands are where the backs of the hands would be on a human.
A rakshasa is about the same height and weight as a human.
Rakshasas speak Common, Infernal, and Undercommon.

combat_description.desc: In close combat, which a rakshasa disdains as ignoble, it employs its sharp claws and powerful bite. Whenever possible, it uses its other abilities to make such encounters unnecessary.

combat_description.name: Detect Thoughts (Su)
combat_description.desc: A rakshasa can continuously use detect thoughts as the spell (caster level 18th; Will DC 15 negates). It can suppress or resume this ability as a free action. The save DC is Charisma-based.

spells.Spells: : A rakshasa casts spells as a 7th-level sorcerer.

name: Rast

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Paralyzing gaze, improved grab, blood drain

special_attacks: Paralyzing gaze, improved grab, blood drain
description: A rast has anywhere from ten to fifteen claws, though it can only use four at once.
A rast has a body about the size of a large dog’s, with a head almost as large as the body. It weighs about 200 pounds.

combat_description.desc: Rasts paralyze as many of their foes as possible, then attack any that are still moving. A rast can claw or bite, but cannot do both during the same round.

combat_description.name: Paralyzing Gaze (Su)
combat_description.desc: Paralysis for 1d6 rounds, 30 feet, Fortitude DC 13 negates. The save DC is Charisma-based.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a rast must hit with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity.

combat_description.name: Blood Drain (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A rast drains blood from a grabbed opponent, dealing 1 point of Constitution damage each round it maintains the hold.

combat_description.name: Flight (Su)
combat_description.desc: A rast can cease or resume flight as a free action. A rast that loses this ability falls and can perform only a single action (either a move action or an attack action) each round.

name: Ravid

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Tail slap +4 melee (1d6+1 plus positive energy) or tail touch +4 melee touch (positive energy)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Tail slap +4 melee (1d6+1 plus positive energy) and claw +2 melee (1d4 plus positive energy); or tail touch +4 melee touch (positive energy) and claw touch +2 melee touch (positive energy)

organization: Solitary (1 plus at least 1 animated object)
description: Ravids are creatures from the Positive Energy Plane. These bizarre entities imbue creatures with energy by their touch and animate lifeless objects around them. Ravids that make their way to the Material Plane wander about aimlessly, followed by the objects to which they have given life.
A ravid is about 7 feet long and weighs about 75 pounds.

combat_description.desc: Ravids fight only in self-defense. A ravid itself is not very powerful but is always accompanied by at least one animated object that defends it.

combat_description.name: Positive Energy Lash (Su)
combat_description.desc: A ravid can make a touch attack or hit with a claw or tail slap attack to infuse a target with positive energy. The energy produces an unpleasant tingle in living creatures, and against undead foes (even incorporeal ones) it deals 2d10 points of damage.

combat_description.name: Animate Objects (Su)
combat_description.desc: Once per round, a random object within 20 feet of a ravid animates as though by the spell animate objects (caster level 20th). These objects defend the ravid to the best of their ability, but the ravid isn’t intelligent enough to employ elaborate tactics with them.

combat_description.name: Flight (Su)
combat_description.desc: A ravid can cease or resume flight as a free action. A rast that loses this ability falls and can perform only a single action (either a move action or an attack action) each round.

combat_description.name: Feats
combat_description.desc: A ravid has the Multiattack feat even through it does not have the requisite three natural weapons.

name: Remorhaz

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Darkvision 60 ft., heat, low-light vision, tremorsense 60 ft.

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Awesome Blow, Improved Bull Rush, Power Attack

description: A remorhaz is whitish-blue in color but pulses with a reddish glow from the heat its body produces. The creature is a little more than 20 feet long, with a body about 5 feet wide. It weighs about 10,000 pounds.
Remorhazes cannot speak.

combat_description.desc: Remorhazes hide under the snow and ice until they hear movement above them, then attack from below and surprise prey.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a remorhaz must hit an opponent least one size category smaller than itself with its bite attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can attempt to swallow the opponent the following round.

combat_description.name: Swallow Whole (Ex)
combat_description.desc: When a remorhaz begins its turn with a grappled opponent in its mouth, it can swallow that opponent with a successful grapple check. Once inside, the opponent takes 2d8+12 points of bludgeoning damage plus 8d6 points of fire damage per round from the remorhaz’s gizzard. A swallowed creature can cut its way out by using a light slashing or piercing weapon to deal 25 points of damage to the gizzard (AC 15). Once the creature exits, muscular action closes the hole; another swallowed opponent must cut its own way out. A Huge remorhaz’s interior can hold 2 Large, 4 Medium, 8 Small, 32 Tiny, 128 Diminutive, or 512 Fine or smaller opponents.

combat_description.name: Heat (Ex)
combat_description.desc: An enraged remorhaz generates heat so intense that anything touching its body takes 8d6 points of fire damage. Creatures striking a remorhaz with natural attacks or unarmed attacks are subject to this damage, but creatures striking with melee weapons do not take damage from the remorhaz’s heat. This heat can melt or char weapons; any weapon that strikes a remorhaz is allowed a DC 18 Fortitude save to avoid destruction. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Remorhazes have a +4 racial bonus on Listen checks.

name: Roc

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness, Flyby Attack, Iron Will, Multiattack, Power Attack, Snatch, Wingover

description: A roc’s plumage is either dark brown or golden from head to tail. These enormous creatures are 30 feet long from the beak to the base of the tail, with wingspans as wide as 80 feet. A roc weighs about 8,000 pounds.

combat_description.desc: A roc attacks from the air, swooping earthward to snatch prey in its powerful talons and carry it off for itself and its young to devour. A solitary roc is typically hunting and will attack any Medium or larger creature that appears edible. A mated pair of rocs attack in concert, fighting to the death to defend their nests or hatchlings.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Rocs have a +4 racial bonus on Spot checks.

name: Roper

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Strand +11 ranged touch (drag) or bite +13 melee (2d6+6)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: 6 strands +11 ranged touch (drag) and bite +13 melee (2d6+6)

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness, Improved Initiative, Iron Will, Weapon Focus

treasure: No coins; 50% goods (stone only); no items
description: A roper stands some 9 feet tall and tapers from 3 or 4 feet in diameter at the base to 1 foot across at the top. It weighs 2,200 pounds. A roper’s coloration and temperature change to match the features of the surrounding cave.
Ropers speak Terran and Undercommon.

combat_description.desc: A roper hunts by standing very still and imitating a bit of rock. This tactic often allows it to attack with surprise. When prey comes within reach, it lashes out with its strands. In melee, it bites adjacent opponents with its powerful maw.

combat_description.name: Drag (Ex)
combat_description.desc: If a roper hits with a strand attack, the strand latches onto the opponent’s body. This deals no damage but drags the stuck opponent 10 feet closer each subsequent round (provoking no attack of opportunity) unless that creature breaks free, which requires a DC 23 Escape Artist check or a DC 19 Strength check. The check DCs are Strength-based, and the Escape Artist DC includes a +4 racial bonus. A roper can draw in a creature within 10 feet of itself and bite with a +4 attack bonus in the same round.

A strand has 10 hit points and can be attacked by making a successful sunder attempt. However, attacking a roper’s strand does not provoke an attack of opportunity. If the strand is currently attached to a target, the roper takes a –4 penalty on its opposed attack roll to resist the sunder attempt. Severing a strand deals no damage to a roper.

combat_description.name: Strands (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Most encounters with a roper begin when it fires strong, sticky strands. The creature can have up to six strands at once, and they can strike up to 50 feet away (no range increment). If a strand is severed, the roper can extrude a new one on its next turn as a free action.

combat_description.name: Weakness (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A roper’s strands can sap an opponent’s strength. Anyone grabbed by a strand must succeed on a DC 18 Fortitude save or take 2d8 points of Strength damage. The save DC is Constitution-based.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: *Ropers have a +8 racial bonus on Hide checks in stony or icy areas.

name: Sahuagin

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Talon +4 melee (1d4+2) or trident +4 melee (1d8+3) or heavy crossbow +3 ranged (1d10/19–20)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Trident +4 melee (1d8+3) and bite +2 melee (1d4+1); or 2 talons +4 melee (1d4+2) and bite +2 melee (1d4+1); or heavy crossbow +3 ranged (1d10/19–20)

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Blindsense 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., freshwater sensitivity, light blindness, speak with sharks, water dependent

organization: Solitary, pair, team (5–8), patrol (11–20 plus 1 3rd-level lieutenant and 1–2 sharks), band (20–80 plus 100% noncombatants plus 1 3rd-level lieutenant and 1 4th-level chieftain per 20 adults plus 1–2 sharks), or tribe (70–160 plus 100% noncombatants plus 1 3rd-level lieutenant per 20 adults, 1 4th-level chieftain per 40 adults, 9 4th-level guards, 1–4 underpriestesses of 3rd–6th level, 1 7th-level priestess, and 1 baron of 6th–8th level plus 5–8 sharks)
description: Most sahuagin feature green coloration, darker along the back and lighter on the belly. Many have dark stripes, bands, or spots, but these tend to fade with age. An adult male sahuagin stands roughly 6 feet tall and weighs about 200 pounds.

Sahuagin are the natural enemy of aquatic elves. The two cannot coexist peacefully: Wars between them are prolonged, bloody affairs that sometimes interfere with shipping and maritime trade. Sahuagin have an only slightly less vehement hatred for tritons.
Sahuagin speak their own language, Sahuagin. Thanks to their high Intelligence scores, most sahuagin also speak two bonus languages, usually Common and Aquan.

combat_description.desc: Sahuagin are savage fighters, asking for and giving no quarter. When swimming, a sahuagin tears with its feet as it strikes with its talons or a weapon. About half of any group of sahuagin are also armed with nets.

combat_description.name: Blindsense (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A sahuagin can locate creatures underwater within a 30-foot radius. This ability works only when the sahuagin is underwater.

combat_description.name: Blood Frenzy
combat_description.desc: Once per day a sahuagin that takes damage in combat can fly into a frenzy in the following round, clawing and biting madly until either it or its opponent is dead. It gains +2 Constitution and +2 Strength, and takes a –2 penalty to Armor Class. A sahuagin cannot end its frenzy voluntarily.

combat_description.name: Rake (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Attack bonus +2 melee, damage 1d4+1. A sahuagin also gains two rake attacks when it attacks while swimming.

combat_description.name: Freshwater Sensitivity (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A sahuagin fully immersed in fresh water must succeed on a DC 15 Fortitude save or become fatigued. Even on a success, it must repeat the save attempt every 10 minutes it remains immersed.

combat_description.name: Light Blindness (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Abrupt exposure to bright light (such as sunlight or a daylight spell) blinds sahuagin for round. On subsequent rounds, they are dazzled while operating in bright light.

combat_description.name: Speak with Sharks (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Sahuagin can communicate telepathically with sharks up to 150 feet away. The communication is limited to fairly simple concepts such as “food,” “danger,” and “enemy.” Sahuagin can use the Handle Animal skill to befriend and train sharks.

combat_description.name: Water Dependent (Ex)
combat_description.desc: Sahuagin can survive out of the water for 1 hour per 2 points of Constitution (after that, refer to the drowning rules on page 304 of the Dungeon Master ’s Guide).

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A sahuagin has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.
*Underwater, a sahuagin has a +4 racial bonus on Hide, Listen, and Spot checks.
*A sahuagin has a +4 racial bonus on Survival and Profession (hunter) checks within 50 miles of its home.
*A sahuagin has a +4 racial bonus on Handle Animal checks when working with sharks.

name: Noble Salamander

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: +3 longspear +23/+18/+13 melee (1d8+9/x3 plus 1d8 fire) and tail slap +18 melee (2d8+3 plus 1d8 fire)

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Constrict 2d8+3 plus 1d8 fire, heat, improved grab, spell-like abilities

traits.name: Feats
traits.desc: Alertness,  Cleave,  Great Cleave,  Multiattack,  Power Attack,  Skill Focus (Craft [blacksmithing])

space_reach.space/reach: 10 ft./10 ft. (20 ft. with tail or longspear)

description: Salamanders speak Ignan. Some average salamanders and all nobles also speak Common.

combat_description.desc: If a salamander has damage reduction, its natural weapons are treated as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction.

combat_description.name: Constrict (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A salamander deals automatic tail slap damage (including fire damage) with a successful grapple check. A noble salamander can constrict multiple creatures simultaneously, provided they are all at least two sizes smaller than it.

combat_description.name: Heat (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A salamander generates so much heat that its mere touch deals additional fire damage. Salamanders’ metallic weapons also conduct this heat.

combat_description.name: Improved Grab (Ex)
combat_description.desc: To use this ability, a salamander must hit a creature of up to one size larger than itself with its tail slap attack. It can then attempt to start a grapple as a free action without provoking an attack of opportunity. If it wins the grapple check, it establishes a hold and can constrict.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Salamanders have a +4 racial bonus on Craft (blacksmithing) checks.

combat_description.name: Feats
combat_description.desc: Salamanders have the Multiattack feat even though they do not have the requisite three natural weapons.

actions.desc: Spear +6 melee (1d6+1/x3 plus 1d6 fire) and tail slap +4 melee (1d4 plus 1d6 fire)

traits.name: Special Attacks
traits.desc: Constrict 1d4 plus 1d6 fire, heat, improved grab

name: Satyr

actions.name: Attack
actions.desc: Head butt +2 melee (1d6) or shortbow +3 ranged (1d6/x3)

actions.name: Full Attack
actions.desc: Head butt +2 melee (1d6) and dagger –3 melee (1d4/19–20); or shortbow +3 ranged (1d6/x3)

description: A satyr’s hair is red or chestnut brown, while its hooves and horns are jet black. A satyr is about as tall and heavy as a half-elf.
Satyrs speak Sylvan, and most also speak Common.

combat_description.desc: The keen senses of a satyr make it almost impossible to surprise one in the wild. Conversely, with their own natural grace and agility, satyrs can sneak up on travelers who are not carefully watching the surrounding wilderness.

Once engaged in battle, an unarmed satyr attacks with a powerful head butt. A satyr expecting trouble is likely to be armed with a bow and a dagger and typically looses arrows from hiding, weakening an enemy before closing.

combat_description.name: Pipes (Su)
combat_description.desc: Satyrs can play a variety of magical tunes on their pan pipes. Usually, only one satyr in a group carries pipes. When it plays, all creatures within a 60-foot spread (except satyrs) must succeed on a DC 13 Will save or be affected by charm person, sleep, or fear (caster level 10th; the satyr chooses the tune and its effect).

In the hands of other beings, these pipes have no special powers. A creature that successfully saves against any of the pipe’s effects cannot be affected by the same set of pipes for 24 hours. The save DC is Charisma-based.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Satyrs have a +4 racial bonus on Hide, Listen, Move Silently, Perform, and Spot checks.

name: Sea Cat

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Darkvision 60 ft., hold breath, low-light vision, scent

description: A typical sea cat is 12 feet long and weighs 800 pounds.

combat_description.desc: Sea cats attack on sight, either for food or to defend their territory, and use both claws and teeth to grab and rend their prey. They display tremendous courage, always fighting to the death, even against creatures many times their size. Pairs and prides of sea cats attack in concert, trying to wear the opponent down until one beast can dispatch it.

combat_description.name: Hold Breath (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A sea cat can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 6 x its Constitution score before it risks drowning.

combat_description.name: Rend (Ex)
combat_description.desc: A sea cat that hits with both claw attacks latches onto the opponent’s body and tears the flesh. This automatically deals an extra 2d6+6 points of damage.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: A sea cat has a +8 racial bonus on any Swim check to perform some special action or avoid a hazard. It can always choose to take 10 on a Swim check, even if distracted or endangered. It can use the run action while swimming, provided it swims in a straight line.

name: Shadow

traits.name: Special Qualities
traits.desc: Darkvision 60 ft., incorporeal traits, +2 turn resistance, undead traits

description: A shadow can be difficult to see in dark or gloomy areas but stands out starkly in brightly illuminated places.
A shadow is 5 to 6 feet tall and is weightless.
Shadows cannot speak intelligibly.

combat_description.desc: Shadows lurk in dark places, waiting for living prey to happen by.

combat_description.name: Strength Damage (Su)
combat_description.desc: The touch of a shadow deals 1d6 points of Strength damage to a living foe. A creature reduced to Strength 0 by a shadow dies. This is a negative energy effect.

combat_description.name: Create Spawn (Su)
combat_description.desc: Any humanoid reduced to Strength 0 by a shadow becomes a shadow under the control of its killer within 1d4 rounds.

combat_description.name: Skills
combat_description.desc: Shadows have a +2 racial bonus on Listen and Spot checks and a +4 racial bonus on Search checks.
*A shadow gains a +4 racial bonus on Hide checks in areas of shadowy illumination. In brightly lit areas, it takes a –4 penalty on Hide checks.
